title: Single-cell atlas of systemic sclerosis skin reveals therapeutic targets via probabilistic modeling and knowledge integration
description: Systemic sclerosis (scleroderma/CREST) features immune dysregulation, fibroblast activation, and progressive tissue remodeling. This repository provides a reproducible single-cell analysis pipeline and drug-repurposing workflow for systemic-sclerosis skin. Using Scanpy and scvi-tools, we integrate samples, perform rigorous QC, and learn a shared latent space with scVI/scANVI to harmonize batches and annotate major cell types (fibroblasts, myofibroblasts, keratinocyte states, endothelial/lymphatic endothelium, myeloid, T/B/plasma cells, dendritic subsets). Differential expression and pathway enrichment (Reactome/GO/KEGG) define state-specific signatures, which are then contrasted against LINCS L1000 perturbational profiles via Enrichr to identify compounds whose transcriptional responses most strongly reverse disease-associated programs. We aggregate reversal evidence across clusters, summarize by mechanism of action, and prioritize candidates with simple robustness checks (dose/time consistency, cross-cluster support). The repository ships notebooks, figures, and a compact “final bundle” (CSV/PNG/HTML) to enable rapid review and downstream validation. All steps—environment, data provenance, parameters, and seeds—are documented to support repeatability. This is research code and not a clinical tool; LINCS cell-line perturbations and bulk-like signatures are proxies for in-tissue effects.
